description:
The second season of Natsume Yuujinchou.

As with its prequel, Zoku Natsume Yuujinchou is about Natsume Takashi, a boy who has had the ability to see youkai since he was young, and his bodyguard youkai, Madara, nicknamed Nyanko-sensei. Natsume attempts to return names written in his Book of Friends, which he inherited from his grandmother Reiko, to youkai in his village. Throughout these adventures, he meets some youkai that are friendly, some that want to steal the Book of Friends, and some that want to kill him. Natsume learns about himself and his relationship with youkai along the way.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)
synonyms: O Livro de Amigos de Natsume 2

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Estranged Family
tags.description: At least one family member of the MC intentionally distances themselves or a family distances themselves from a person related to the MC.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

tags.name: Exorcism
tags.description: Involving religious methods of vanquishing youkai, demons, or other supernatural entities.

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [older animator](https://anilist.co/staff/250761/) by the same name._

Callin' (高鈴) is a Japanese acoustic band from Kyoto Prefecture. The band was formed in 1998 by vocalist Takane Yamamoto (山本高稲) and guitarist Akihisa Yamaguchi (山口彰久). In 2003, they signed with Sony Records and made their major debut with the single "Mayonaka no Koukai".

A 6-member Japanese rock band, formed in Sendai in 1998. They broke up in 2010.
